newsitem.title: USA: STAC sees higher operating expenses.
newsitem.headline: STAC sees higher operating expenses.

text.p: Stac Inc said on Monday it expects operating expenses to rise from current levels in its second quarter ending March 1997, as it boosts spending on product development and hires a significant number of direct sales personnel during the period.

In a statement accompanying first-quarter results, Stac Inc said operating expenses for the quarter ended Dec. 31, 1996 were $7.1 million compared to operating expenses of $5.5 million in the same quarter the previous fiscal year.

Research and development expenses for the December 1996 quarter rose to $2.3 million from $1.6 million a year earlier due to the addition of software development personnel to support the ReachOut, Replica and Hi/fn product lines. Sales and marketing expenses for the December 1996 quarter were $3.6 million, an increase of $829,000 from those of a year earlier.

Net income for the December 1996 quarter was $0.07 per common share compared to a loss of $0.33 per share for the quarter ended December 31, 1995. Excluding a charge related to the purchase of California Software Inc, net income for the year ago quarter was $0.10 a share.
